text: Belpre is a city in Edwards County, Kansas, United States. In 2020, 97 people lived there. ==History== Belpre was created in 1879. It was incorporated in 1906. Belpre's name came from the French word "belle prairie" for "beautiful meadow". The first post office in Belpre was created in 1879. ==Geography== Belpre is at (37.950669, -99.099822). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of . All of it is land. ===Climate=== Belpre has hot, humid summers and generally mild to cool winters. The KÃ¶ppen Climate Classification system says that Belpre has a humid subtropical climate, abbreviated "Cfa" on climate maps.Climate Summary for Belpre, Kansas ==People== ===2020 census=== The 2020 census says that there were 97 people, 40 households, and 28 families living in Belpre. Of the households, 75.0% owned their home and 25.0% rented their home. The median age was 26.8 years. Of the people, 62.9% were White, 1.0% were Native American, 21.6% were from some other race, and 14.4% were two or more races. Hispanic or Latino of any race were 69.1% of the people. ===2010 census=== The 2010 census says that there were 84 people, 34 households, and 18 families living in Belpre. ===2000 census=== The 2000 census says that there were 104 people, 45 households, and 28 families living in Belpre. ==References== ==Other websites== ;City * Belpre - Directory of Public Officials ;Schools * USD 351, local school district ;Maps * Belpre City Map, EdwardsCounty.org * Belpre City Map, KDOT Category:Cities in Kansas Category:1879 establishments in Kansas
